Andrzej Jan Taramina wrote:
> Though I'm not too partial to the APP acronym, given how 
> oftern the term "app" is uses in the IT field, there does 
> need to be a distinction between the Atom XML format (what 
> feeds and entries look like) and the Atom Publishing Protocol 
> (how to use HTTP/REST to access/manipulate feeds/entries), 
> since they are different things altogether.

Yes, it really is a regrettable usage.

It would have been better had it been something like:

- APUB
- ARAP (Atom REST Access Protocol)
- AAP (Atom Automation Protocol)

Or almost anything else for that matter.
